MIP39c3-SP2: Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) Offboarding - No While the team agrees that offboarding CU SH-001 is a valid budget cut, we have already indicated support for a similar proposal written by Rune, which we believe manages the offboarding process in a superior way. This new and improved proposal is in the pipeline and will be active for voting in the near future. We also look forward to Maker swag at BYEVinity at ETH Devcon Bogota, which is a very important and productive use of this CU. MIP55c3-SP7: Special Purpose Fund for The Ambassador Program - Yes We support the decision to allocate 81,000 DAI to the LatAm Ambassador Program as an experiment to lower the linguistic barrier to entry for Maker DAO. We hope that this leads to more involvement from top talent from around the world. In the future, we would like to explore other options for increasing participation. For instance a bounty system for Maker document translation. While we love seeing MakerDAO approach other regions outside the English speaking world, we see much too little viewers and participation on the current LatAm pages. If this doesn’t improve in the next six months, Flipside will not support this program going forward. MKR Compensation for StarkNet Engineering Core Unit  - Yes Attracting and retaining engineering talent is hard. Attracting talent that is fluent in programming secure applications in Cairo is even harder. While we’re less than thrilled about the way this MKR compensation was proposed post hoc, we want to make sure MakerDAO remains a place that attracts talented engineers and approve this MKR vesting. MIP77: Delegates in the Maker Protocol - Yes Voting Yes on this proposal feels weird, because it could be seen as a naked cash grab. But at the moment Flipside Crypto would not profit from an increase in pay by the proposed new remuneration. We are, however, actively pursuing previously undelegated MKR to delegate to us, which would mean a higher percentage of total MKR active in governance, if successful. This is on top of the already high workload of helping to steer the DAO through its current transformation. The workload is certainly more than one full time employee can shoulder, and Flipside Governance is in the lucky position to have multiple contributors available to deploy to the challenges at hand. We would love to grow this effort, but would need to feel it is economically viable in the long term to justify these additional expenses to our leadership team. We support the decision to align expectations between the Maker Community, MKR holders, Core Units, and Recognized Delegates. This proposal provides an initial framework for the components of a Recognized Delegate role, which we hope to develop and make robust. We applaud Patrick_J for summarizing and clarifying the expectations, and responsibilities of delegates in MakerDAO and overhaul the compensation and measurement structure so that the most important parts of participation are measured appropriately, while total remuneration can grow if delegates can attract previously undelegate MKR. We believe that this will be a net positive for the protocol and the DAO and that it will help governance to professionalize. It will also help offset some of the legal risks, as has become obvious just yesterday. MIP4c2-SP24: Amend Measurement Period For Delegate Participation Metrics - Yes We approve this amendment to the measurement period for delegates, even though it will be superseded by MIP 77-79 should it pass. In the event of the Delegate MIP set not passing, this amendment represents an improvement over the current measurement period, which covers the entire lifetime of delegates. MIP40c3-SP80: Modify GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget - Pay 150% We voted for a matching 100% of the DAI salaries with MKR and want to thank GovAlpha for their diligence and humility. Initial research into traditional company equity vesting has found that community managers and researchers usually receive little to no equity compensation, which is why we chose the lowest option. If it were possible, we would allow any number here, but the DAO has a fiscal responsibility to its token holders, so this is the kind of compromise we can get behind.  EDIT: Thanks to feedback from @ultraschuppi, we amend our rationale for this poll. GovAlpha is so much more than just research or community management. We want to make sure that we do not imply that GovAlpha are mere community managers, important as this role might be. What GovAlpha are doing is central to the functioning of the DAO, and without their quiet, neutral, and loving care, the whole would be less than the sum of its parts, not more.

MakerDAO votes week #39 of 2022: [rETH] Collateral Onboarding Risk Evaluation Update  - Yes We approve the parameter updates for rETH and hope the RocketEth users will flock to Maker to open DAI vaults as a result. Just today I read that 11 of the last 20 blocks of a sample from yesterday used MEVBoost with TornadoCash sanctions censoring transactions on the protocol level. This endangers the very future of Etherum and as a result of Maker. RocketEth offers an alternative and is more important than ever. Collateral Auctions: Analysis & Parameter Updates - September 2022  - Yes We support optimizing auction parameters for reduced slippage and want to thank the Risk CU team for their detailed reasoning and explanation behind this update MIP6 Application: RFA - Canadian Federally regulated mortgage originator  - No We do not support the MIP6 application of RFA because we feel that while the proposal was very thoughtful, the current macroeconomic environment will not be kind to residential mortgages. MakerDAO is better served with pursuing highly liquid RWA with the least possible default risk.

MakerDAO votes week #40 of 2022: Parameter Changes Proposal - PPG-OMC-001 - 29 September 2022 - Yes We support the MOMC recommendation and the ongoing experiment with low stability fees. We hope that decentralized collateral is attracted by these incentives. Multisig to manage the $VELO veNFT  - Yes Flipside volunteered as a signer for the Velodrome multisig and is looking forward to actively aiding MakerDAO in managing it’s Velodrome veNFT. MIP6: Anchorage Lending Crypto Mining Collateral Onboarding Application - No We want to thank Anchorage Lending for their well put-together application but can not support this at the current moment. The DAO is in the process of restructuring its RWA efforts and we feel the applicant would not find the ideal experience, now. We’re also concerned about the ASIC miners as underlying assets for the loans originated. We have seen regulators take a more critical stance towards Proof or Work mining. Justified or not, this ongoing shift in sentiment creates additional risk here.

MakerDAO votes week #41 of 2022: Proposal to whitelist Oasis.app on rETHUSD Oracle - Yes We approve the Oasis.app Oracle access for rETH/USD. We’re looking forward to Oasis onboarding new users to this collateral like it did for other collaterals in the past. Change PSM-GUSD-A parameter - Yes Pretty exciting to see the Maker having the possibility of earning yield on its actual PSM. We want to thank Gemini for their proposal and are excited to see this come to fruition. Ending DAI Funding for Sourcecred - Yes Not an easy decision to make. Sourcred was instrumental in onboarding community members and a fantastic incentive for new delegates to cut their teeth on creating MIPs. However, recent payouts to obvious farming behavior have demonstrated limitations. Flipside is looking forward to working with GovAlpha and developing the next generation of this system. Modify D3M Guidance for MOMC  - Yes Voting yes on removing the yield from the bar calculation. Aave and Maker cannot be compared on the merit of rates alone. Maker needs to decide whether to service users directly, which would mean a lower dust limit, or make good use of its D3M facility. This seems like a very valuable experiment to run. Modify D3M Guidance - Spread - 0.50% and 0.00% DAI supply rules supreme. DAI is the product people trust and love, and we’re happy to see Aave users adopt it, even with no revenue to Maker. We hope most will borrow DAI against decentralized collateral to offset the DAO’s massive USDC and stablecoin exposure.

MakerDAO votes week #43 of 2022: Latest endgame-prelaunch-mip-set topics  - Yes We support the Endgame Plan and are looking forward to ushering in a new paradigm in scaling decentralized organizations. MetaDAOs will unlock productivity and innovation in the Maker ecosystem and make sure Maker remains the number one DeFi protocol. We are here to support the Endgame Plans execution with data, insights, and hands-on implementation wherever possible and want to make sure the DAO enters a new age of productivity and success. The vision is there, we’re here to make it happen. MIP81: Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards - Yes Flipside Governance supports this proposal and wants to thank Coinbase for getting the ball rolling on PSM yields. We will continuously monitor the ongoing needs of the DAO and recommend specific steps for addressing them going forward.

Due to the differences in timezones between our European delegates and Flipside Crypto’s finance department we missed a round of votes. We still want to give our rationale so the community can see our reasoning and bring transparency to the forums. Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001) - Yes Andrew Burban embodies the excitement, the passion and the soul of MakerDAO. We feel that his services will be needed for as long as Maker exists, and even more so when multiple metaDAOs want to form a tight-knit community. That being said Flipside Governance felt that a Core Unit was not the right way for this relationship to blossom and we support the offboarding proposal. We hope that Strategic Happiness (DAO, Inc, LLC, …) will remain a valuable partner for MakerDAO for a long time to come. Quite frankly: no one out there makes swag like that. Offboarding the Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) - Yes Offboarding these kick-ass, talented individuals a few months after approving their budget is not the easiest decision, and we want to extend our heartfelt sympathies to the contributors. Given current developments, we concluded that event coordination is best outsourced or a part of Growth CUs mandate, as the DAO works its way back to profitability. Offboarding the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001) - Abstain While we do feel there is precedent for off-boarding with a golden parachute, we are ultimately uncomfortable with the amounts that have been proposed. Thus we are abstaining. MIP82: Monetalis/Coinbase Appaloosa - Yes Voting Yes on this interesting yield opportunity. MakerDAO as a lender to institutional clients? Sounds about right. Our only concern is that MIP81 and MIP82 together earmark a critical part of MakerDAO’s PSM funds for Coinbase custody or as a client. While Coinbase is among the most respected institutions in crypto, we feel that the DAO should diversify counterparty risk in the long run. MIP55c3-SP9: Legal and Commercial Risk Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral BlockTower Credit (RWA Arranger) SPF - Yes We approve the necessary funds for the domain work on the BlockTower credit greenlight, and want to ask SF CU to update the table containing RWA SPFs with this additional information. BlockTower is a major Maker (MKR) stakeholder right now and we look forward to this ongoing relationship. MIP4c2-SP26: Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments - Yes The current facilitator offboarding process includes a long and painful delay. Painful for the facilitator, who has to remain in limbo until clarity can be reached, and painful for their core unit and the wider DAO. The proposal introduces welcome adjustments and we support it. MIP41c5-SP12: Facilitator Offboarding (RWF-001) - Yes We support the offboarding of Will Remor as Facilitator to RWF-001 CU. See our remarks to the RWF CU offboarding poll for further details.

Week 45 of 2022 Parameter Changes Proposal - PPG-OMC-001 - 28 October 2022 – Yes We support increasing the debt ceiling to 160 million for the Compound DM3 as well as the parameter changes for MANA–A; reduce debt ceiling to 10 million & increase stability fee to 7.5%. The latter is a rationale choice in the face of low MANA liquidity and high risk positions. We agree that the former should bring 1.8 million DAI in annualized revenue and are excited to see the Compound V2 D3M activated. [Signal Request] The SHCU Requests a moment of your time – No While we appreciate the SHCU’s contribution to Maker prior to offboarding, we do not believe this is an appropriate use of funds at this time. [Signal Request] Clear Vaults’ Bad Debt in the MakerDAO protocol – Yes Clearing vaults’ bad debt is good risk management to clean up Maker’s balance sheet. We then supported the regular executive and look forward to seeing Maker teleport implemented on StarkNet. We also supported the emergency executive to limit contagion risk from current market conditions.

MakerDAO votes week #46 of 2022: [USDC-A, USDP-A, GUSD-A] Liquidation parameters & Auctions activation - Yes We approve the liquidation parameters for USDC-A, USDP-A and GUSD-A vaults as proposed by RISK CU. It’s a testament to the market conditions that this is happening now, but we feel it is a prudent step for any market.

MakerDAO votes week #47 of 2022: BlockTower Credit (Arranger) - Collateral Onboarding / Collateral Onboarding Applications (MIP6) - Yes Kevin Miao and his team are not only well aligned with MakerDAO through their MKR holdings, they also displayed the highest level of professionalism and diligence during their community calls. We’re happy to support this MIP6 application and look forward to seeing what the four RWA vaults from BlockTower can do for the DAO. [GNO] MIP6 Collateral Onboarding Application - GnosisDAO - Yes Some have pointed out that GNO collateral might not be profitable initially. We’d say that this small cost is well worth it. GnosisDAO has expressed interest in a long-term, mutually beneficial relationship. Their team is of the highest caliber and their security concern is visible in everything they do. We gladly support this application. [renBTC-A] Proposed Offboarding Parameters & Context  - Yes We support the gentle offboarding of this tail-end collateral, especially in light of recent events around REN and FTX. Thanks to RISK CU for their prompt action and sensible guidance. [Request to Poll] Poll to move forward with the commercial risk, legal, technical, and other work necessary to onboard the deal outlined in MIP90 - Yes We approve SF moving forward with the work necessary in the MIP90 deal. See our rationale for onboarding BlockTower. MIP89: Monetalis - Arrow Andalusian - Yes We approve investing 300MM DAI into Blackrock/iShares ETF products to prop up earnings and diversify out of our dependence on Circle. That said, we want to point out that RWA monitoring solutions are not where they need to be and encourage Monetalis to provide cutting-edge reporting to the DAO. MIP88: Monetalis - Redwood Friesian - No We’re not entirely comfortable with a residential mortgage-backed investment in the current market. Monetalis is MakerDAOs prime arranger for RWAs, and we had the pleasure of meeting part of the team in Barcelona. We’re confident that the deal is well-sourced and vetted, but we currently do not support it. MIP40c3-SP86: Modify TechOps Core Unit DAI Budget  - Yes We approve the TechOps CUs budget. However, we encourage tighter budgeting practices moving forward if the CU is to charge both the broader DAO and CUs individually for services. We will monitor the situation closely going forward. MIP40c3-SP85: Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget (SAS-001)  - Reject Budget SAS built a kick-ass product during its incubation period and developed it into a delightful whole. With considerable sadness, we feel that the current market conditions and the necessity to fill the POVE mean we can no longer fund the ongoing development as a core unit. We’re sure the talented engineers in SAS can get tightly scoped SPFs approved and transition to being ecosystem actors as quickly as possible. MIP40c3-SP84: Modify Core Unit Budget (COM-001) - Approve Budget Not only is this Core Unit exemplary in its frugal budgets, they perform its mandate with zest and professionalism. We happily support the GovComms budget and rely on their MIPs at a glance, Forum Recaps, and coordination skills almost every day. MIP40c3-SP83: Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit Budget (IS-001)  - Reject Budget We approve the current budget for the Immunefi CU. We’ll monitor funds’ use closely to ensure that all unused expenditures are returned to the DAO. MIP86: CoinShares Active Treasury Management  - Yes We approve MIP86 and commend CoinShares for their proactive approach to the Maker community. We were happy to hear they already offer a transparent monitoring solution for their products. They would willingly work with PE and RISK to develop a smart contract solution to manage our exposure making automatic parameter updates possible. The deal would ramp up slowly as we get more comfortable with the counterparty. Supported. Modify the Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit Budget - Speedy Operations SES has an integral role in the current shift to the Endgame paradigm and has delivered an excellent framework for project-based financing as well as accounting and governance dashboards we often use and reference for our decisions. Even the larger “Speedy Operations” budget represents a substantial reduction year over year, which is why we’re happy to support this option. Modify Emulated Surplus Buffer Upper Limit - No We do not believe this is the right approach to managing stETH exposure and trust the experts in the RiskCU to manage the POVE. We will continue to monitor the risk parameters closely and make recommendations if we see the necessity. Modify Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget (SAS-001) - Reject Budget SAS built a delightful product during its incubation period, which is currently used for liquidating the more exotic collateral types. We feel there is a place for ongoing development as an ecosystem actor that contracts with metaDAOs and core units on a project-to-project basis. That being said, we think it is no longer fitting to support the development of this product as a MakerDAO core unit and are confident that this team will find plenty of customers on their own. OUSD Decentralized Rewards - No Following recommendations from RiskCU and the general market sentiment, we do not feel confident that expanding into OUSD collateral is a sensible direction for MakerDAO. We want to thank the Origin team for their effort and are certain they will find widespread success as soon as markets recover. Modify Development & UX Core Unit Budget (DUX-001) - Current Budget DUX builds products that delight. Immunefi Security Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - No We commend psychonaut for his tenacity and ongoing commitment to MakerDAO, even in adversity. Ultimately we do not see sufficient grounds for approving a Co-facilitator. We’re voting Reject Budget on the ISCU’s proposal and voting to not renew their mandate. We hope psychonaut will continue to offer his services via SPFs or as an EA. MIP40c3-SP83: Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit Budget (IS-001)  - Reject Along with the proposal for approval of a co-facilitator and the ISCU’s mandate, we’re voting NO on this poll for a budget. Immunefi should transition to becoming a valuable ecosystem actor as soon as possible. We’re looking forward to seeing Joshua Pritkin’s contribution to the transformation of MakerDAO. MIP39c2-SP38: Modify Immunefi Security Core Unit Mandate (IS-001)  - No Along with the proposals for the ISCU Budget and the ISCU co-facilitator, we’re voting No on this poll. We value the contribution of ISCU but think it should transition to becoming an ecosystem actor.

MakerDAO votes week #48 of 2022: DAI Savings Rate - 1%, 0.75% We vote for a 1% DSR rate as an experiment that needs to be closely monitored. The best case scenario is that it increases DAI demand and supply via the PSM. And that MakerDAO could finance the yield through existing RWA programs, especially MIP81. Risks: Apart from MIP81, most RWAs offer deferred yield, whereas DSR payouts are due immediately. This could introduce a liquidity risk. MakerDAO is also accepting stETH as collateral with 0% SF. We could have stETH deposited for additional yield via the DSR, with no SFs to offset the cost. All in all a big push. We think it’s the right push, but it needs to be constantly monitored to ensure we know what price we’re paying. We updated the vote and added 0,75% as second choice to help the IRV poll selecting a winner. Parameter Changes Proposal - PPG-OMC-001 - 24 November 2022  - Yes We approve the parameter changes and cleanups to reflect the current market situation. Specifically reducing the ETH-B line to 250MM and the WBTC-A line to 500MM. Also excited to increase the wstETH-A and wstETH-B lines to 500MM. Poll to move forward with the commercial risk, legal, and other work necessary to increase the NS-DROP DC to 50M DAI - Yes We approve Strategic Finance undertaking the necessary legal and risk work to increase New Silver’s debt ceiling to 50M DAI, favorable assessment withstanding.

MakerDAO votes week #50 of 2022: Change of Ownership of the Ambassador Program’s Multi-Sig  - Yes We support swapping one of the owners from the Ambassador Multisig to Sebix from Kat. Thanks for stepping in, Sebix. All the best to Kat. Candidates for Dai Foundation Board Member Election Poll  - 0xbocaJ We choose 0xbocaJ as a candidate for the Dai Foundation Board. 0xbocaJ has been active in the community for considerable time and displayed a deep understanding of the DAO and the current transition to the Endgame Plan. We’re glad that he has been nominated. Caveat: We have heard that 0xbocaJ has a role as outside counsel to Redwood of Monetalis Redwood fame. We expect complete transparency and clarity about any conflicts of interest arising out of this function. Request to Poll: SAS Spending Permission  - Yes We’re happy to see the talented SAS developers pivot to provide services to the Endgame Plan transition and approve the requested financing for December 2022 to March 2023. MakerDAO needs development talent, and SAS is qualified. While we voted No on the budget for the continuation of the development of the auction platform, because we couldn’t see enough use to justify the cost, we’re looking forward to seeing the team’s contribution to the ongoing reorganization, which brings copious amounts of development challenges. GovComms Winddown Spending Permission - Yes We approve the requested spending so the GovComms facilitator can gracefully wind down the operation. Maker should take care of its own, even if it’s time to unwind some roles. To David: Thank you for handling this matter with professionalism, and emotional maturity. We were deeply impressed. Ratification Poll for Pioneer DeFi-focused Language Dataset for the Benefit of Risk Modelling & Governance Communication (MIP55c3-SP11)  - No We do not support the requested funding for the language dataset analysis. We also want to express our concern for the level of vitriol in the discussion and would have liked to see a more conciliatory tone aimed at resolution. We do not see this poll as a No to pvl, whom we respect, nor as a blanket Yes to Risk CU, although we find no fault on their part, and think their conduct so far has been exemplary. We’re rather saddened that this experiment has become a platform for political activity.

MIP4c2-SP31: MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment - Yes We approve the Amendments to the Maker Keeper Network and thank hexonaut for the diligence and depth of understanding he displayed in this proposal. MIP55c3-SP14: Defense Fund - Yes A lot of discussion centered around the whether funds should be approved before the whole product is developed or later. We want to think Layer Zero for taking ample time out of his busy schedule to address these questions in detail and in full transparency. We approve this MIP55c3 and are looking forward to the first anon friendly defense fund in the industry at scale. Maker is once again blazing ground. Caveat: The funds need to be tightly monitored and regular reporting needs to be in place. We are looking to SES and LayerZero to provide regular updates to the community here. MIP92: Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield - Yes Yearn is one of the premier names in the DeFi business and one of the principal innovators. While we see that YFI vaults are currently almost empty at 14.2% of the Debt Ceiling we welcome the opportunity to generate yield in a completely decentralized fashion and to deepen the partnership with this stalwart. Fee sharing has been offered by Yearn and is an important reason why we approve. We encourage the Yearn DAO and its community to use MakerDAO YFI vaults more so these two DAOs can align further. MIP13c3-SP13: Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults - Yes Flipside Governance and Feedblack Loops proposed this MIP13c3 and we support it wholeheartedly. Flipside is not set to profit from this proposal in any way, so there are no conflicts of interest on our side. We want to see MakerDAO thrive and it can only reasonably hope to do so if it can monitor collateral it has existential exposure to. We’re deeply grateful for the dialogue on the forums and hope that solutions will help clarify what kinds of RWA collateral MakerDAO can monitor cost effectively. MIP63c4-SP5: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation  - Yes The Chainlink team offers to run a trial period pro-bono and the proposal already shows a deep understanding of the relevant matters. We gladly support this proposal MIP55c3-SP12: Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs - Yes Flipside approves the additional 209,000DAI requested for risk and legal domain work. We want to thank AES and adcv for providing the requested materials to support our decision in a timely manner. MIP14c2-SP2: Subproposal for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund ISCU from Dec 2022 to May 2023  - Yes Approving 43,560 DAI to ISCU to remunerate psychonaut for orderly wind down and work he has already done in the last 7 weeks. MIP14c2-SP1: Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023  - Yes Approving 138,894 DAI for TechOps to fund operations till February. We’re very pleased to see this kick-ass team move forward in their transition to Endgame and becoming professional actors in the ecosystem. MIP39c3-SP7: Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) - 80% / 100% / Reject Thanks to David Utro for his long standing service as a community member and as a facilitator for GovComms. While the dialogue around the concrete sum for the golden parachute was a little more contentious than we would have hope we feel a decent compromise has been reached. MIP4c2-SP32: Remove MIP14c4: Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling - Yes Moving forward in this transition period we expect to see many more of these funding requests. We even submitted one ourselves just last week. Approving this to unlock our future. MIP4c4-SP3: Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) - Yes This proposal seems humdrum until you realise how important it is. MIPs and governance output needs to be put to careful scrutiny in regular intervals and quickly and effectively dispatched if it no longer serves its original purpose or any purpose at all. Rules are cheap, compliance is expensive. MIP4c4-SP2: MIP14 Repeal - No We think MIP14 will be one of the important instruments to fund the transition to Endgame. We need it. Not approved. MIP4c2-SP28: Amend MIP51 to remove MIP51c4: Calendar Exceptions - Yes We want to give Maker governance the ability to react at all times - even during times when the workforce takes a much needed, and well deserved break. We think it is imperative that this break is observed and want to make sure the social contract around this time of respite and family reunification is kept as sacred as possible. Voting Yes on this MIP to increase the potential flexibility of MakerDAO governance, not to remove the only agreed upon break from a protocol that demands a lot from its participants. The pause is as important as the note, as Miles Davis said, allegedly… MIP4c2-SP29: Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics  - Both / Executive modifier only / Abstain modifier only We appreciate this proposal and its push to tighten up participation metrics for Recognized delegates. Maker delegates are the industry standard and should aim to push this ever higher.

Due to an issue with internal processes these two votes where not submitted on time. The issue has since been resolved. We want to communicate our rationale nevertheless. Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout) - Yes Swapping to DAI seems like something that should be possible for any Maker user with minimal friction. Given the current perceived risk around Gemini and GUSD it feels wrong to charge risk averse holders for their way out. Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling - No change / Decrease to 0MM While we think that the discussion around the risk of holding substantial amounts of GUSD and especially holding large parts of the entire market capitalization of this stablecoin is very pertinent, we believe lowering the DC is not the right step to take now.  It doesn’t actively reduce the exposure, and at the same time, sends a signal of distress to the wider world and thereby increasing the actual risk. Gemini have been nothing but an exemplar as a partner, and this action is done without giving their team a chance to actively build trust Nothing about GUSD is substantially riskier now than 3 months ago when we approved 500MM. Nothing about GUSD seems materially different than USDP from a risk perspective.  Once more, the existential exposure of MakerDAO to centralized stablecoins is starkly illuminated, and the necessity to decrease it to a more manageable level is becoming as clear as day. We will support proposals that actively go in this direction.

MIP55c3-SP13 : Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster - No We salute Rajiv for his initiative and experimenting with how to get the transition to Endgame funded and started. At the current stage we feel this proposal is not scoped well enough. We would like to see a proposal where the work the DAO will receive is clearly defined and priced, and look forward to supporting this fine group of talent on their way to the future.

Week from 2023-01-31 MIP14c2-SP3: Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund Endgame Information Portal - Yes We believe information about the Endgame and especially an easy portal where potential contributors can onboard is important, and are excited about using a JokeDAO contest to gather ideas from the wider MakerDAO community about how to approach this best. We don’t see this as a competitor to GovAlphas portal, but as a potential improvement, or as a potential supplement to the great effort by LFW and others. Executive vote: We approve the temporary shutdown of the Maker Teleport, Offboarding GovComms and the transitory funding of TechOps CU.

Update the Multisig Managing the Velodrome NFT - Yes We approve adding CodeKnight and StableLabs as signers for veNFT management, which will become a three of five multisig. Thanks to @MakerMan for establishing what turned out to be a profitable strategy. Parameter Changes Proposal - PPG-OMC-001 - 2 February 2023 - Yes We approve the proposed parameter changes, including the increased stability fees for wstETH. Slowly turning on the D3M again is great, too. Maker deserves a place at the heart of DeFi. Supporting this weeks executive to lower dust floors on select vaults and send payment streams to Keepers.

Ratification Poll for Restart a daily $100 Micro-Burn of MKR in Show of Good Faith to MKR Holders (MIP74c1-SP1) - No While we think that burning MKR or some other form of value accrual for MKR token holders is a top priority the proposed micro burn would not achieve the desired effect while binding engineering resources.

We want to thank all our delegators for trusting us with their MKR—especially @rune for trusting a newcomer with such a substantial delegation. But we feel equally committed to the more than 22 other delegators who have voted for Flipside Governance by delegating their precious MKR. It is time for us to renew our delegate contract, and we would appreciate your continued support. Here’s a link to our new delegate contract. Maker Governance - Flipside Governance Delegate Information (makerdao.com) We compiled a report of what we have done under your mandate as delegates, which you can download as a PDF here: MakerDAO_Delegate_Renewal___Flipside_Governance.pdf - Google Drive. We will continue to give our best and feel very fortunate to be a part of this vibrant, sometimes chaotic, always opinionated and clearly gifted community.

Polls 2023-02-22 PECU Seeking Governance Clarification of Intent re: Phoenix Labs - Yes We approve the PECU resources necessary to audit the D3M to Spark Lend. The current transition has some very unique challenges and we support a more lenient approach to principles for this unique period. Thanks to Derek for seeking formal ratification. PECU Seeking Approval to Transfer Engineering Resource to Phoenix Labs  - Yes Hexonaut is the technical force behind Spark Lend. He is trail blazing this transition and we gladly approve the transfer of this outstanding builder. MIP13c3-SP14: Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address  - No While it is certainly sad if people lose their funds by sending DAI to the DAI contract address we feel that now, more than ever, the engineering resources for this solution are not available. We would love to see this developed at some point in the future, but chose to vote No on this poll to make scheduling easier for PECU. MIP4c2-SP33: Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities - Yes Excellent housekeeping. We support the proposed solution, to address responsibilities after offboarding GovComms. MIP4c2-SP30: Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process  - Yes MakerDAO learned a lot when CES was looking for an interim facilitator and this MIP formalizes and institutionalizes these learnings. Full support. MIP95: $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations  - Abstain The Cogent Bank deal is exactly what MakerDAO should support. Salt-of-the-earth bank doing small business loans. Good volume, great underwriting, known Arranger. But the RWA scope is under development and due to be ratified as soon as next month, and at the same time Risk and Legal assessments are not yet budgeted for. We decided to vote Abstain. We’re happy if this moves forward, and want to encourage Max Glass and Cogent to retry when the RWA scopes have been defined, if it doesn’t. At the moment we cannot fully support this MIP.

Emergency Executive vote 2023-03-11 1500UTC: supported. We still believe turning the D3M off was unwarranted and that the GUSD drama is mostly FUD. But we support the current executive and want to thank the Risk and PE CUs for the swift turnaround here. Crazy times.

Maker Governance - Decrease the RETH-A Dust Parameter - Yes We supported decreasing the rETH Dust limit. Rocketpool ETH ftw, what more do we need to say. Decentralization for the win! Maker Governance - Short Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs Initial Funding (MIP55c3-SP15) - Yes We’re pretty excited about Spark. So is all of DeFi. LFB!

Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No We’d like to see the Yearn vault move forward in bigger steps. But after the relevant scopes have started their tasks. Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Very good exercise to test the rails here. Fully supported. Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes All the heat aside: Monetalis is awesome. We’re happy to have the opportunity for MakerDAO to earn more. Remove the DC-IAM from MIP65 (RWA00 Voted: No While we support the increase of the DC, we want to keep the 100M IAM in place until the kinks in the reporting and accounting pipeline have been ironed out. We know this has a decent opportunity cost but voted No out of an abundance of caution.
Comms update: We supported the Emergency Executive of 2023-03-14 to use MOMs for PSM shutdowns. We need a breaker switch in cases like last weekend.
